intro: Memecylon sivadasanii, commonly known as Sivadasan's memecylon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to the Western Ghats of India, where it thrives in moist, tropical forest environments. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
